title: Test if a binary tree is balanced.
hint: Think of a classic binary tree algorithm.
problem:
A binary tree is said to be balanced if for each node in the tree, the difference in the height of its left and right subtrees is at most one. A perfect binary tree is balanced, as is a complete binary tree. A balanced binary tree does not have to be perfect or complete---see the figure for an example.

Write a program that takes as input the root of a binary tree and checks whether the tree is balanced.

The binary tree class is

   class BinaryTreeNode {       public T data;       public BinaryTreeNode left, right;   }   public BinaryTreeNode(T data) { this.data = data; }   public BinaryTreeNode(T data, BinaryTreeNode left,                          BinaryTreeNode right) {     this.data = data;     this.left = left;     this.right = right;   }
